raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard Pendle PT tokens to Aave V3 Core Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## [TEMP CHECK] Onboard Pendle PT tokens to Aave V3 Core Instance

## Author: ACI

## Date: 2024-12-10

### **Summary**

This TEMP CHECK proposes to onboard Pendle PT tokens to Aave V3 Core Instance. 

### **Motivation**

Pendle allows users to split yield bearing tokens into principal (PT) and yield (YT) components. This opens the door to trading yield for the growing number of yield bearing tokens, and gives users additional options for  yield farming strategies. A notable feature of the PT tokens is that at the maturity date, the value of the PT equals the value of the underlying asset and can be redeemed for the underlying. This means PT tokens, which can be bought at a discount within Pendle pools, represent the fixed rate part of a Pendle asset pair. 

Pendle has seen extremely high growth this year, with current TVL of circa $4.5 billion. Along with this growth has come the desire for yield traders to borrow against their Pendle PT tokens. This represents a multi-billion dollar growth opportunity for Aave, without a large increase in risk if PT  tokens are onboarded for already listed assets such as sUSDe.

We propose listing an initial PT token as a test use case to see user demand and work through the full integration of a PT token: 

- PT-sUSDE-29MAY2025

In future we propose listing sUSDe and USDe PT tokens for new maturities as required.

### **Specification**

PT-sUSDE-29MAY2025: [0xb7de5dfcb74d25c2f21841fbd6230355c50d9308](https://etherscan.io/address/0xb7de5dfcb74d25c2f21841fbd6230355c50d9308)

### Risk Parameters

Risk parameters will be provided by Risk Service Providers in the ARFC discussion thread.

### **Useful Links**

https://docs.pendle.finance/ProtocolMechanics/YieldTokenization/PT

### Disclaimer

ACI is not directly affiliated with Pendle and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal. Some ACI employees may hold Pendle tokens.

### **Next Steps**

1. Collect community & service providers feedback on this TEMP CHECK.
2. Escalate the proposal to TEMP CHECK Snapshot.
3. Publish ARFC to gather community and Service Providers feedback.
4. Escalate the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage if feedback is positive.
5. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived under [CCO](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.body:
---
Title: [ARFC] Onboard USDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum 
Date: 2024-05-13
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
---

### Summary:

This is an ARFC to seek approval for the addition of USDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum, as there’s been already a successful onboarding for sUSDe (staked USDe)  on Ethereum.

### **Motivation**

Ethena’s synthetic dollar, USDe, provides a stable crypto-native solution for a cash and carry structured product. The staked version of USDe, sUSDe, earns yield from the protocol and has high potential for strong borrow demand, which was already onboarded successfully into Aave. 

The current ARFC plans to onboard USDe on Aave v3 Ethereum.

### **Specification**

USDe: (0x4c9edd5852cd905f086c759e8383e09bff1e68b3)
[Etherscan link](https://etherscan.io/token/0x4c9edd5852cd905f086c759e8383e09bff1e68b3)

### Risk Parameters

ARFC has been updated with Risk parameters provided by Risk Service Providers in the ARFC discussion thread.

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (USDe) | 80M |
| Borrow Cap (USDe) | 72M |
| UOptimal | 80% |
| Slope1 | 9.00% |
| Slope2 | 75.00% |
| Debt Ceiling | $40M |
| LTV | 72.00% |
| LT | 75.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 8.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |

### **Useful Links**

[[TEMP CHECK] Onboard sUSDe to Aave v3 Ethereum](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/16840)

[[ARFC] Onboard sUDe to Aave v3 on Ethereum](https://governance.aave.com/t/arfc-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/17191/6)

### Disclaimer

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Ethena and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

### **Next Steps**

1. Collect community & service providers feedback on this ARFC.
2. Escalate the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage if feedback is positive.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived under [CCO](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

---
### [ARFC]  Onboard sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum 

### Author:  ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

### Date: 2024-04-01

---

### **Summary**

This is an ARFC to seek approval for the addition of sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum, following the consensus reached in the [TEMP CHECK](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881) stage.

### **Motivation**

As discussed in the TEMP CHECK, Ethena's synthetic dollar, USDe, provides a stable crypto-native solution for a cash and carry structured product. The staked version of USDe, sUSDe, earns yield from the protocol and has high potential for strong borrow demand. 

### **Specification**

sUSDe: [0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497](https://etherscan.io/token/0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497)

### Risk Parameters

Risk parameters have been provided by Chaos Labs in the ARFC discussion thread. 

Initial Risk Parameters are the following:

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | No |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (sUSDe) | 85M |
| Debt Ceiling |40M |
| LTV | 72.00% |
| LT | 75.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 8.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00%|
|Flashloanable|No|
|Siloed Borrowing|No|
|Borrowed in Isolation|No|
|Emode|No|

### **Useful Links**

[TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/16840)
[TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881)

### Disclaimer

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Ethena and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

### **Next Steps**

1. Collect community & service providers feedback on this ARFC.
2. Escalate the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage if feedback is positive.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

## Date: 2024-11-05

---
> Risk Parameters have been updated accordingly with Risk Service Providers feedback 2024-11-26


### **Simple Summary:**

The current ARFC aims to onboard SCR, the native token of Scroll, on the Aave V3 Scroll Instance. This onboarding will allow Aave users to supply and borrow SCR, thereby enhancing the utility and liquidity of the Scroll token within the DeFi ecosystem and more specifically, within the Aave ecosystem.

### **Motivation/Background:**

Scroll is an Ethereum Layer 2 chain which already has an Aave instance deployment and SCR is the governance token for the Scroll L2. By onboarding SCR to Aave V3, we aim to create new opportunities for Aave users to engage with this emerging staking ecosystem, while expanding SCR’s liquidity.

**Benefits of listing this token:**

Provide opportunities for Aave users to borrow against their SCR to unlock liquidity, or alternatively to borrow SCR against other collateral allowing them to participate in Scroll governance.

**Market Impact:**

We see no significant market impact from onboarding SCR except for providing new opportunities to Aave users which may cause users to switch from borrowing other tokens against their collateral. Overall we see onboarding SCR as net good for Aave users as it expands opportunities for them to engage in a new L2 ecosystem.

**Chain to be deployed/listed:**

Scroll.

**Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:**

POL and Deposit Commitments will be discussed at the ARFC stage. 

As disclosed by Marc Zeller, founder of ACI, the ACI Multisig has received 510K SCR on behalf of Aave DAO. Those funds will be coordinated with Karpatkey and Tokenlogic to define best usage of this airdrop. 

### **Specification**

Risk Parameters have been provided by Risk Service Providers on 2024-11-25

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Network | Scroll |
| Isolation Mode | N/A |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | No |
| Supply Cap | 360,000 |
| Borrow Cap | 180,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | - |
| LTV | - |
| LT | - |
| Liquidation Bonus | - |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | - |
| Variable Base | 0.0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 7.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.0% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 20.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flashloanable | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowable in Isolation | No |
| E-Mode Category | N/A |

### **Useful Links:**

- [Scroll website](https://scroll.io/)
- [Scroll docs](https://docs.scroll.io/en/home/)
- [[TEMP CHECK]Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-scr-to-aave-v3-scroll-instance/19568)
- [[TEMP CHECK Snapshot] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x900027a0dc30946b463ce8e57a8901b5fc1158546b4d00acae4d2d823d8de732)

### **Disclaimer:**

This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with Scroll and did not receive compensation for creation of this proposal.

ACI and ACI employees may be holders of SCR.

### **Next Steps:**

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### **Copyright:**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard & Enable eBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Core Instance
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard & Enable eBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Core Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## Author: @ACI
## Date: 2024-11-28

---
# **Summary**

This proposal aims to onboard and enable eBTC/WBTC (Etherfi) liquid E-Mode for the Core Instance. By implementing this change, we seek to enhance capital efficiency for borrowers using eBTC/WBTC as collateral.

# **Motivation**

The motivation behind this proposal stems from several key factors:

- High Utilization: eBTC/WBTC has demonstrated significant usage as collateral for borrowing stablecoins on the platform.
- Capital Efficiency: Enabling liquid E-Mode for eBTC/WBTC will allow borrowers to substantially improve their capital efficiency when using this asset as collateral.
- Controlled Growth: Liquid E-Mode provides a mechanism for more precise control over the growth and borrow demand in relation to the overall stablecoin liquidity within Aave v3 on Core Instance.
- Enhanced Borrowing Capacity: This change will enable users to borrow larger amounts of other stablecoins against their eBTC/WBTC collateral, potentially increasing platform utilization and revenue.

By implementing this proposal, we aim to optimize the use of eBTC/WBTC within the Aave ecosystem, attracting more liquidity.

# **Specification**

This proposal will add eBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode. Risk Parameters will be provided by Risk Service Providers and ARFC will be updated accordingly when ARFC is posted.

## Useful links

[**BGD. Aave v3.2: Liquid Emodes**](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-v3-2-liquid-emodes/19037) 

[**ARFC Snapshot**](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x68ce69b5e71df1d77c2ad814a5d41162a40be54473576ff590d0b1bb5afde4a7)

[**Github**](https://github.com/aave-dao/aave-v3-origin/tree/v3.2.0)

[**AIP**](https://vote.onaave.com/proposal/?proposalId=178)

# Disclaimer

This proposal is directly powered by ACI (Aave Chan Initiative). ACI did not received compensation for creation of this proposal.

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this TEMP CHECK, escalate to Snapshot stage.
2. If TEMP CHECK passes, escalate this proposal ARFC and later to the Snapshot stage.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: The proposal to onboard Pendle PT tokens to Aave V3 Core Instance is strongly supported by timeline voting analytics, showing unanimous and stable early and late support for YAE. Forum discussion reveals mixed sentiment with a slight dominance of negative sentiments due to pricing and risk concerns, but positive voices emphasize the potential growth and safe oracle design. Historical similar proposals focused on onboarding assets to Aave V3 with strong positive vote leads, though past onboarding saw post-vote market declines, indicating caution but not disapproval of growth opportunities. The timeline metrics and market impact suggest favorable reception and potential benefit for Aave.
key_arguments_for: Timeline voting shows 100% lead for YAE with stable support across quartiles.
Robust risk assessments and dynamic linear discount oracle recommended for safe pricing.
Pendle PT tokens offer fixed yield exposure and new capital efficiency opportunities.
Community and risk providers support launching with close monitoring.
key_arguments_against: Concerns about leveraged loop trading risks similar to Morpho.
Complexities and risks in pricing and oracle accuracy noted by some community members.
High concentration of liquidity providers poses some risk.
Some forum sentiment expresses caution over PT borrowing and volatility.

evidence.quote: Forum comments reflect mixed sentiment: negative from risk concerns and complexity, positive from support for pricing solutions and growth potential.
Timeline analysis shows 100% lead for YAE option with strong stability and early voting dominance.
Past proposals onboarding tokens to Aave V3 showed unanimous early vote leads but post-vote token price and TVL declines, teaching caution.

decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline analytics, forum sentiment, and historical lessons; excludes ex-post tally.

references.title: [ARFC] Onboard Pendle PT tokens to Aave V3 Core Instance

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline voting metrics show unanimous and stable support for YAE, indicating strong community approval.
- Forum sentiment analysis reveals a mix of positive and negative views; however, overall support for onboarding with risk mitigation measures is evident.
- Historical similar proposals, while showing post-vote market declines, demonstrate that the protocol continues to pursue growth and innovation cautiously.
- Market impact and TVL projections are positive, supporting the decision to onboard Pendle PT tokens.
- The recommendation aligns with majority sentiment, reflecting community views and prioritizing Aave's durable benefit.
